pr_title: Add instructions for IDEA community edition isers

timeline.bodyText: I am just guessing but this looks like a URL that is IBM specific, should it go to the repository?
timeline.author: balhar-jakub
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,29 @@
+#
+services:
+    - serviceId: datasets
+      title: IBM z/OS Datasets
+      description: IBM z/OS Datasets REST API service
+      catalogUiTileId: datasetsAndUnixFiles
+      instanceBaseUrls:
+          - https://tvt5003.svl.ibm.com:8547/

timeline.bodyText: Same here, should the sample contain link to the specific system?
timeline.author: balhar-jakub
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -14,24 +14,21 @@
 #   http --verify=keystore/local_ca/localca.cer GET https://localhost:10010/api/{zosmf-service-id}/zosmf/info 'X-CSRF-ZOSMF-HEADER;'
 #
 services:
-    - serviceId: zosmf                                            # unique lowercase ID of the service
+    - serviceId: zosmf                                          # unique lowercase ID of the service
       title: IBM z/OSMF                                           # Title of the z/OSMF service in the API catalog
       description: IBM z/OS Management Facility REST API service  # Description of the z/OSMF service in the API catalog
       catalogUiTileId: zosmf                                      # ID of the API Catalog UI tile for z/OSMF services
       instanceBaseUrls:                                           # list of base URLs for each instance
-        -                                                         # scheme://hostname:port/contextPath
-      homePageRelativeUrl:                                        # Home page of the z/OSMF service
-      routes:
-        - gatewayUrl: api                                         # [api/ui/ws]/v{majorVersion}
-          serviceRelativeUrl: /                                   # relativePath that is added to baseUrl of an instance
-        - gatewayUrl: ui
-          serviceRelativeUrl: /
+        - https://TVT5003.svl.ibm.com:00443/zosmf/                # scheme://hostname:port/contextPath

timeline.bodyText:
Is there a reason to turn off the verification of the certificates?
The certificates for the local development are packaged in the repository
timeline.author: balhar-jakub
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -9,7 +9,7 @@ apiml:
         staticApiDefinitionsDirectories: config/local/api-defs
     security:
         ssl:
-            verifySslCertificatesOfServices: true
+            verifySslCertificatesOfServices: false

timeline.author: balhar-jakub
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -8,12 +8,12 @@ apiml:
         discoveryServiceUrls: https://localhost:10011/eureka/
     security:
         auth:
-            provider: dummy
+            provider: zosmf
             zosmfServiceId: zosmf  # Replace me with the correct z/OSMF service id
             passTicket:
                 timeout: 360 # [s] - default timeout to expire (z/OS has 10 mins as default)
         ssl:
-            verifySslCertificatesOfServices: true
+            verifySslCertificatesOfServices: false

timeline.author: balhar-jakub

timeline.bodyText:
Here again I will probably keep the HTTPS as default even for local.
Maybe is there any way we can help you with preparing some docker with the setup for IBM environment?
timeline.author: balhar-jakub
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -7,13 +7,14 @@
     },
     "scripts": {
         "api-layer": "concurrently --names \"GS,DS,AC,DC\" -c cyan,yellow,white,blue npm:gateway-service npm:discovery-service npm:api-catalog-service npm:discoverable-client",
+        "api-layer-debug": "concurrently --names \"GS,DS,AC,DC\" -c cyan,yellow,white,blue npm:gateway-service-debug npm:discovery-service npm:api-catalog-service npm:discoverable-client",
         "api-layer-core": "concurrently --names \"GW,DS,AC\" -c cyan,yellow,white npm:gateway-service npm:discovery-service npm:api-catalog-service",
         "api-layer-without-gateway": "concurrently --names \"DS,AC,DC\" -c yellow,white,blue npm:discovery-service npm:api-catalog-service npm:discoverable-client",
         "api-layer-without-discovery": "concurrently --names \"GW,AC,DC\" -c cyan,white,blue npm:gateway-service npm:api-catalog-service npm:discoverable-client",
         "api-layer-without-catalog": "concurrently --names \"GW,DS,DC\" -c cyan,yellow,blue npm:gateway-service npm:discovery-service npm:discoverable-client",
-        "gateway-service": "java -jar gateway-service/build/libs/gateway-service.jar --spring.config.additional-location=file:./config/local/gateway-service.yml --apiml.security.ssl.verifySslCertificatesOfServices=true",
-        "gateway-service-debug": "java -Xdebug -Xrunjdwp:transport=dt_socket,server=y,address=5010,suspend=y -jar gateway-service/build/libs/gateway-service.jar --spring.config.additional-location=file:./config/local/gateway-service.yml",
-        "discovery-service": "java -jar discovery-service/build/libs/discovery-service.jar --spring.profiles.active=https --spring.config.additional-location=file:./config/local/discovery-service.yml --apiml.security.ssl.verifySslCertificatesOfServices=true",
+        "gateway-service": "java -jar gateway-service/build/libs/gateway-service.jar --spring.config.additional-location=file:./config/local/gateway-service.yml --apiml.security.ssl.verifySslCertificatesOfServices=false",

timeline.message:
Add instructions for IDEA community edition isers

Signed-off-by: Jordan Cain <jordan.cain1@uk.ibm.com>
